summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to UBS Financial Services, Inc., demanding extensive financial records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and several associated entities for the period from January 1, 2018, onward. The document includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing criminal investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena demands all financial records for accounts and entities associated with Ghislaine Maxwell, including personal accounts, an IRA, and several corporate entities she is linked to.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for UBS
events.description: The subpoena commands UBS Financial Services, Inc. to appear before the grand jury or produce requested records by this date.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to UBS Financial Services for records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and associated entities.

locations: U.S. Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
UBS Financial Services, Inc., 1000 Harbor Blvd 8th Floor, Weehawken, NJ 07086
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an ongoing federal grand jury criminal investigation into suspected felony violations, including conspiracy (18 U.S.C. ยง 371).
It seeks extensive financial records from UBS for Ghislaine Maxwell and entities including Terramar Project Inc., Max Foundation, and ELLMAX, LLC, from January 1, 2018, onward.
The government explicitly requests UBS not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve investigation confidentiality.
The requested records include wire transfers, signature cards, identification documents, safe deposit records, credit card statements, and all correspondence related to the accounts.
